com.complexible.common.protocols.server.rpc

Interface ServerFunction<C extends MessageContext>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractServerFunction

    public interface ServerFunction<C extends MessageContext>

    Plugin interface for extending the RPC server.

    Instances of ServerFunction should be thread-safe.

    Since:
    0.8
    Version:
    2.0.1
    Author:
    Michael Grove

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canHandle(MessageType theType)
      Return whether or not this server plugin can handle responding to a message of the provided type.
      com.google.common.collect.Range<Integer> getMessageRange()
      Return the range of messages this function can handle.
      void handleMessage(Message<C,?> thePacket, io.netty.channel.Channel theChannel)
      Handle the RPC call contained in the packet.

    • Method Detail

      • getMessageRange

        com.google.common.collect.Range<Integer> getMessageRange()
        Return the range of messages this function can handle.
        Returns:
        the valid message range

      • canHandle

        boolean canHandle(MessageType theType)
        Return whether or not this server plugin can handle responding to a message of the provided type.
        Parameters:
        theType - the type to check
        Returns:
        true if it can handle the message, false otherwise

      • handleMessage

        void handleMessage(Message<C,?> thePacket,
                   io.netty.channel.Channel theChannel)
            throws Exception

        Handle the RPC call contained in the packet. Response to the call is written to the provided Netty channel. All responses written to the channel should be instances of Message

        Session initiation is handled by the core server. Server functions can assume that handleMessage will be called with a valid user logged in, but it is the responsibility of the ServerFunction to appropriately logout when the action is completed.

        Parameters:
        thePacket - the packet containing the RPC information
        theChannel - the channel to write the result to
        Throws:
        Exception - if there was an error invoking the method
